physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Progressive stupor and decerebrate rigidity developed after admission.
Developed melaena, requiring cessation of heparin infusion.
Generalised areflexia and hypotonia; inability to walk; no dysarthria or nystagmus.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Neurological examination indicated severe areflexic tetraparesis after recovery of consciousness.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Psychiatrically stable; absence of neurological findings such as dysarthria or nystagmus.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Previous findings of severe areflexia and hypotonia improved as the patient became psychiatrically stable.
